00229 THINKGEAR_API int
00230 TG_SetDataLog( int connectionId, const char *filename );
00231 
00232 
00233 /*
00234  * Writes a message given by @c msg into the Connection's Stream Log.
00235  * Optionally the message can be written onto a new line preceded by
00236  * a timestamp.  The Connection's Stream Log must be already opened
00237  * by TG_SetStreamLog(), otherwise this function returns an error.
00238  *
00239  * @param connectionId    The ID of the ThinkGear Connection to write
00240  *                        into the Stream Log for, as obtained from
00241  *                        TG_GetNewConnectionId().
00242  * @param insertTimestamp If set to any non-zero number, a newline
00243  *                        and timestamp are automatically prepended
00244  *                        to the @c msg in the Stream Log file.  Pass
00245  *                        a zero for this parameter to disable the
00246  *                        insertion of newline and timestamp before
00247  *                        @c msg.
00248  * @param msg             The message to write into the Stream Log
00249  *                        File.  For Stream Log parsers to ignore
00250  *                        the message as a human-readable comment
00251  *                        instead of hex bytes, prepend a '#' sign
00252  *                        to indicate it is a comment.
00253  *
00254  * @return -1 if @c connectionId does not refer to a valid ThinkGear
00255  *         Connection ID handle.
00256  *
00257  * @return -2 if Stream Log for the @c connectionId has not been
00258  *         opened for writing via TG_SetStreamLog().
00259  *
00260  * @return 0 on success.
00261  */
00262 THINKGEAR_API int
00263 TG_WriteStreamLog( int connectionId, int insertTimestamp, const char *msg );
00264 
00265 
00266 /*
00267  * Writes a message given by @c msg into the Connection's Data Log.
00268  * Optionally the message can be written onto a new line preceded by
00269  * a timestamp.  The Connection's Data Log must be already opened
00270  * by TG_SetDataLog(), otherwise this function returns an error.
00271  *
00272  * @param connectionId    The ID of the ThinkGear Connection to write
00273  *                        into the Data Log for, as obtained from
00274  *                        TG_GetNewConnectionId().
00275  * @param insertTimestamp If set to any non-zero number, a newline
00276  *                        and timestamp are automatically prepended
00277  *                        to the @c msg in the Stream Log file.  Pass
00278  *                        a zero for this parameter to disable the
00279  *                        insertion of newline and timestamp before
00280  *                        @c msg.
00281  * @param msg             The message to write into the Data Log
00282  *                        File.  For Data Log parsers to ignore
00283  *                        the message as a human-readable comment
00284  *                        instead of hex bytes, prepend a '#' sign
00285  *                        to indicate it is a comment.
00286  *
00287  * @return -1 if @c connectionId does not refer to a valid ThinkGear
00288  *         Connection ID handle.
00289  *
00290  * @return -2 if Data Log for the @c connectionId has not been
00291  *         opened for writing via TG_SetDataLog().
00292  *
00293  * @return 0 on success.
00294  */
00295 THINKGEAR_API int
00296 TG_WriteDataLog( int connectionId, int insertTimestamp, const char *msg );
